abstracts.cdata!:
This environment impact assessment (EIA)
            for the Second Northern Uganda Reconstruction Project
            consisted of screening to determine if the project hah
            significant impacts. Because this project was determined not
            to have the potential to have significant environmental
            impacts, it is excluded from further environmental impact
            assessment. However, this report contains recommendations to
            the developer for sound environmental management of the
            project, as is customary for projects in this category. As
            this project is classified as a Financial Intermediary
            Project (FI), any activites which might violate World Bank
            safeguard policies have to be identified. Accordingly, what
            follows is a summation of an analysis of relevant safeguard
            policies: This project will put in place in place and EA
            framework for the sub-projects cycle to ensure environmental
            awareness and compliance. Subprojects supporting protection
            and maintenance of natural habitats will be funded. Possible
            subprojects might address pest control and rodent extinction
            for sanitary reasons. DDT can potentially be procured, e.g.,
            for malaria vector control. Cumulative effects of
            deforestation due to brick-burning, charcoal-making, and
            cultivation will be prevented or mitigated. The preservation
            of cultural property may be safeguard relevant to this project.
